{{also|劣币驱逐良币}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=劣币驱逐良币|type=11211}}

===Etymology===
Literally: “Bad money drives out good.” / “The bad coins drive out the good coins.”

Possibly a calque of {{m|en|bad money drives out good}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=liè bì qūzhú liáng bì
|cat=prov
}}

# Mediocre talent will drive away people of real talent.
# [[bad money drives out good]] ({{w|Gresham's law}})
